title: Why the Dropout2d and BatchNorm2d's model.eval() result is poor
body_html: Recent I'm doing a project using the elegant tool,pytorch. I use the dropout2d and batchnorm2d in my network.The trained model performance well in the test phase if I didn't using the model.eval(). However,when I use the model.eval(), the result is very pool. I really feel confused.I sincerely hope the developer can help me solving this confusion. Thank you very much!
